description: From Latin ophites, from Ancient Greek ὀφίτης (ophítēs) (Etymology 2, below). Compare ophites.

entries.meaning: (geology) Any of various rocks having snake-like markings, such as a mottled greenish porphyry. [from 16th c.]

adjectives.description: ophite (comparative more ophite, superlative most ophite)

examples: The idols represented the eons, divine emanations, and their origin was probably ophite – about which we know a thing or two at first hand.
